entry.title: Guide for Inline Translations of Embedded SAC Stories in SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM
entry.content:
Embedded SAC stories in Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM include a useful feature called Inline Translation. This feature allows customers to create and manage translations for story-related metadata during story creation or editing.

Inline Translation vs. Metadata Translation vs. Data Translation

It’s easy to mix up these three terms, so here’s a simple breakdown:

  • Inline Translation
    Refers to metadata created within an Embedded SAC Story. Examples include the story title, description, page titles, and widget titles. In short, anything you create inside the Embedded SAC environment.
  • Metadata Translation
    Applies to the metadata of Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM—for example, the titles of data sources and their fields. This feature is not yet supported but will be available soon.
  • Data Translation
    Refers to translations of actual business data, such as code descriptions and extension code lists, in Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM. This is already supported.

How to Enable Inline Translation

Enabling Inline Translation is a two-step process. Please note that this needs to be done for each story individually.

Step 1: Enable Translation for a Story

This is a one-time setup per story.

  1. Go to All Settings → Analytics → Design Stories.
  2. Select the story you want to translate and click Edit.
  3. In edit mode, click the gear icon under the File section, then select Story Details.
  4. In the pop-up window, turn on the Enable Translation toggle and click Save.
  5. After the pop-up closes, save the story again.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Important: The language you are logged in with becomes the source language for that story. This cannot be changed later. Make sure you log in with the correct language before enabling translations.

Step 2: Maintain Translations for Target Languages

This step must be repeated for every target language you want to support.

  1. Open the Embedded SAC story in Edit mode.
  2. From the menu, select Tools → Inline Translation (or More → Tools → Inline Translation).
  3. In the pop-up, choose the Target Language from the dropdown list.
  4. Update the text fields with the translated content. The source language text will appear by default.
  5. Click Done, then save the story.

 

 

 

 

 

 

What Business Users Will See

Once translations are maintained, your business users will automatically see story texts in the language they use to log in to Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP ESM.

entry.title: Re: OUTB Delivery - Picking Request Doc do not confirm
entry.content:
I guess, the picking confirmation is not passed properly in the FM you were using. Please note, the VBPOK_TAB table which you were referring must include

  • Picked quantity
  • Confirmed quantity
  • TAQUI = 'X' (Picking confirmation flag)

The delivery number (VBELN) in both VBPOK_TAB and VBKOK must match the Picking Request Document, not just the Outbound Delivery. This is a subtle but critical distinction. So check whether you are testing with the above correct parameters

entry.title: Re: Adaptation project - adaptable business service in the MTA
entry.content:
Hi @hristotsolev, I have a question about which service details need to be added to the mta.yaml, as described in the document.

https://help.sap.com/docs/bas/developing-sap-fiori-app-in-sap-business-application-studio/adaptation-project-on-cloud-foundry

resources:
- name: risk_service
	type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service	
	parameters:
		service: grc-risk (// is this service available in the service marketplace or available as application service in the space?)
		service-name: risk_service
		service-plan: standard

Is the grc-risk service available in the Cloud Foundry service marketplace, or is it exposed only as an application service within the space? I’m comparing it to the connectivity service.

 
name: test-connectivity
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    service: connectivity
    service-plan: lite
as in documentation it is mentioned as: 

  • service – the technical name of the service offering that you want to add. You can find it in the Cloud Foundry service marketplace page as the secondary title for that service.

  • service-name – the name of the instance of the service that is created. You can find it in the column named Instance in the table on the service instances page, in the SAP BTP cockpit.
 
I have a CAPM application deployed and want to extend one of the apps in the app folder using an Adaptation Project. What configuration do I need to add, and could you  help me with the documentation to set it up?

entry.title: Finance Part1 - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

In the 5th session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Finance (part 1)

  • Recording - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance Part1)
  • Presentation - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance Part1)  
  • Accelerator Guide
    • Finance - SSCUI and Application Checklist
    • Pre-defined Selection Variants (Finance AP_AR)
    • Migration of Asset Accounting Master Data and Postings
    • Migration of G/L Account Balance and Open Line Items

Key Discussion Points‌

1. Master Data Migration‌

  • ‌GL Accounts‌: Extend to the new EUR company code via Manage GL Account Master Data (batch copy limited to 500 accounts).
  • ‌Bank Accounts‌: Manually configure in all systems (dev/test/prod) using Manage Bank Accounts. Extend House Banks in all systems to new company code using Manage Banks – Cash Management
  • ‌Cost Centers/Profit Centers‌: Reuse existing codes or migrate via cockpit, adjusting validity periods.

‌2. Configuration Checks (SSCUI)‌

  • Mandatory settings include:
    • Currency configuration (reference currency must be EUR, not BGN).
    • Local Chart of Accounts assignment to new company code
    • Default account assignments (for automatic postings on revenue/expense accounts).
    • Payment methods and bank determination rules for AP/AR.
    • Cash Journal

‌3. Transactional Data Migration‌

  • ‌AP/AR‌: Clear open items, extract data via Manage Supplier/Customer Line Items, and migrate using templates.
  • ‌GL Balances‌: Migrate only open-item-managed accounts for open line item migration; migrate balances for non-open item managed GLs separately. Reconcile tax/GIR accounts before migration and settle open tax items.
  • ‌Down payments‌: Recreate requests in the new company code and clear payments manually.

‌4. Post-Cutover Activities‌

  • Disable BGN bank statements and enable EUR statements – bank to include new bank accounts in MBC list.
  • Retain limited access to the old company code for audit adjustments.

Live Questions & Answers

Topic Area‌

‌Question‌

‌Answer

Block Posting

How to lock the old company code? We do it somehow in the org structure or we block the possibility to make postings (which SSCUI can be used for that)?

You can block postings in the old company code by closing the posting periods with app "Manage Posting Periods".

  • Close the financial periods to avoid posting in the old company code.
  • Open the app Manage Posting Periods and select the posting period variant of the old company code and click on Go.
  • Select All the posting period variant items and click on the Set Posting Periods button. Assign the posting periods and save the changes

You can also block all GL accounts for posting in old company code in app "Manage GL Accounts Master Data"

  • Select the view “Company code view”, add the old company code and click on Go.
  • Select all the G/L accounts and click on the Mass Change button and select other attributes.
  • In the new screen Mass Change in Company Code View, select in the Blocked for postings “Replace – All” and “By – Yes”. Click on the Apply button.
  • Click on the Save button once you confirm the changes in the Items table.

Org Structure

We have created the new company code recently. We saw that the old one in the org structure has a tick for "Default company code for the country" - at what point this tick is moved to the company code and by whom - SAP or us?

As explained in KBA 3580645 - Default Company Code checkbox in SAP Central Business Configuration's Organizational Structure - SAP for Me its purpose is purely for technical reasons. This setting is assigned once per country with the first company code that is activated for that country to have technical information about initial deployments between CBC and S/4.

There are no business impacts regarding company code and currency operations, neither any impacts during upgrades or updates.

Furthermore, we can also note that if the issue concerns to the default company code settings for end users, it should not be a concern. This is because the defaults for end users are entirely controlled through user settings.

Any other presence of the existing "old" company code in the system poses no risk, given that no users or accesses are assigned to it, and posting periods/posting variants are not maintained. Additionally, please rename the currency BGN company code to "do not use" for greater visibility.

Cost Center

A question regarding the cost centers and in particular their codes - as far as I understand we can still use the current cost center codes by copying them to the new company code, is that correct? What do to if there are transactional data posted or commitments?

That is correct. You can create a new validity period for them starting on 01.01.2026. But this will not be possible if there are any transactional data posted against the cost center. The cost center ID will stay as it was before.

Plan data could be deleted. However, this is not possible for actuals/commitments.

In such a case you need to create new cost centers.

Transport

We are on 2SL. Are we going to copy old (in BGN) to new (in EUR) company code, is this going to be available?

Yes, if you are on CBC 2SL, similarly as for 3SL, except you do not have a Test system where you need to replicate master data or transport configurations. You only need to transport to Prod system

Call-to-Action

Register and Attend Upcoming Webinar presented by SAP Service experts with practical suggestions

  • Register Now [Sept 10th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance Part2, Analytics)
  • Register Now [Sept 24th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales, Q&A for all area)
  • please kindly bookmark this blog - How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers (with all accelerators, replay, upcoming session)

Please view all content and raise questions with tag #Bulgaria

entry.title: SOST Transcation taking long time to open / Ending up with TIME OUT Dump
entry.content:
Issue  : 

  • It took very long time to display the send requests in SOST
  • Or it ended with following runtime error

          Category ABAP programming error
          Runtime Errors TIME_OUT
          ABAP Program SAPLSX11
          Application Component BC-SRV-COM

          Short Text
          Time limit exceeded

          What happened?
          Program "SAPLSX11" has exceeded the maximum uninterrrupted runtime and has
          therefore been terminated.

Cause : 

There are too many send requests in SAPConnect queue or SAPOffice tables contain huge amount of entries.

Resolution : 

Follow the SAP Note : 3164602 - It takes long time to open SOST or runtime error TIME_OUT occurs

Even if SAP Note solution doesn't work, Here is the solution :

Need to create secondary index to improve response time using below query : 

create index <SCHEMA>."SOES~<Index ID>" on <SCHEMA>."SOES" (MANDT, STATUS, SNDDAT, MSGTY)

Ex : create index SAPSR3."SOES~A1" on SAPSR3."SOES" (MANDT, STATUS, SNDDAT, MSGTY)

Note: Before implementing any changes directly in the Production system, always test them first in a Development or Quality environment. This helps ensure stability, prevents unexpected disruptions, and validates the solution safely.

entry.title: Re: Understanding HANA memory related license utilization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Dear @Grace2012 ,

Q1: how can customer monitor on the usage of RAM, you mentioned Health Monitoring of Cloud ALM, if in China, there is no Cloud ALM, how customer can check on this figure?

A1: On the S/4 tenant the app 'HANA Memory Analysis' can be used to track
a) the history of actively used memory broken down by 'memory consumers', e.g. column store / row store for the data footprint and 'DB management' for processing of queries.

b) the allocated memory, which is the basis for the license calculation (based on the 3rd highest peak of the last 30 days). The allocated memory is displayed as a line and refers to the axis on the right hand side. 

Q2. if contract max usage should be 200G, and customer useing to 220G, what will happened? whether system will be slow?

A2: There is no throttling mechanism to slow down the system on purpose. The required memory is provided to avoid system standstill and keep the system up and running, but the customer will no longer be compliant in terms of license usage and should get in touch with SAP.

entry.title: Re: Adding a hyperlink to adobe forms
entry.content:
it's 8 years late but I believe it would help someone else query . 
Your script  saved my day also.

See if you have set the field format to rich text and code should be in java script in client. 

And for dynamic URL try to add the url and the description text (whatever is dynamic) via an importing or global parameter and add it in your form , preferably in the same subform .

Below is how I did it : 
var linknode = xfa.resolveNode("data.#subform.BPDATA.PROJPROPOSAL.GV_PVLINK") ;
var link = linknode ? linknode.rawValue : "";
var pvidNode = xfa.resolveNode("data.#subform.BPDATA.PROJPROPOSAL.GV_PVID");
var pvid = pvidNode ? pvidNode.rawValue : "";
\\give if else condition if needed
var part1 = <body xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:xfa="http://www.xfa.org/schema/xfa-data/1.0/" xfa:APIVersion="2.4.5325.0"><p><a href={link}>{pvid}</a></p></body>;
var defaultText= part1.toXMLString();
this.value.exData.loadXML(defaultText, false, true);

Like this it should work . 
Code should be in the initialise section of the field.

entry.title: Re: Storage location not found for profile R61I error whe...
entry.content:
Hi Aye Chan

SSCUI 103186 is only available if the relevant scope item is activated in your solution.

  • This SSCUI belongs to the Retail or Store Operations scope.
  • If you do not see SSCUI 103186 in Manage Your Solution → Configure Your Solution, it means the corresponding scope item is not yet part of your activated scope.

I suggest you proceed as follows:

Check your Scope Items

  • Go to Manage Your Solution → View Solution Scope.
  • Search for the Retail / Store-related scope item (e.g., Store Layout & Store Profile Management).
  • If it is not active, this explains why SSCUI 103186 is not visible.

Activate the Scope Item.

  • To do this, open an implementation project in Central Business Configuration.
  • Then add the relevant Retail Store scope item to your scope. After activation, SSCUI 103186 will become available under Configuration.

Alternatively, if your project does not use the Retail scope, you will not be able to access this SSCUI at all (it is not a general Logistics or MM SSCUI, but specific to Retail).

SAP S/4HANA Cloud SSCUI

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: ‌🇵🇱‌ Webinar: Implementing SAF-T in Poland (JPK) with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Join us for an exclusive webinar for Partners on implementing SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for Poland's Standard Audit File-Tax (SAF-T) regulations. SAP Document and Reporting Compliance helps businesses manage their statutory reporting requirements and electronic documents submissions to government authorities across the globe.

​This webinar is designed to equip you with the knowledge necessary to enable businesses to configure and setup SAF-T Poland in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. Through live demonstrations by experts, you'll uncover the intricacies of deploying this powerful solution to ensure smooth and effective compliance with local tax authorities.

- Introduction to Standard Audit File-Tax (SAF-T) - Statutory Reporting in Poland (JPK) with SAP – Recording available here (Request access here)

This workshop is ideal for consultants eager to enhance their expertise and value in the domain of finance and tax compliance. Secure your spot now to be part of this transformative learning experience!

Date and Time
23 Sep 2025, 10.00 AM – 11.30 AM CET

entry.title: Preliminary What’s New Information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1
entry.content:
Preliminary version of What’s New information and of the Product Assistance are now available for customers and partners to get a preview on the upcoming new and changed features of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1.

You can find this preview on the current SAP Help Portal page SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (see What’s New section “Preview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1”). To access the Preliminary What’s New information, please use the What’s New Viewer or the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool.

The RASD tool provides you with a personalized and tailored view on What’s New information based on the activated and used scope within your system. The preliminary information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1 will be available in RASD within the next few days. We recommend using RASD to prepare for upgrades and updates of your system and to focus on the new and changed features that are relevant for you. A valid S-User ID is needed to use the RASD tool and to view all the preliminary content stated above.

For any feedback you may have, try the Commenting Feature for What's New documentation in this release. See this blog for more information.

entry.title: Re: What professional challenge or hiccup have you learned the most from?
entry.content:
I believe some of my biggest learnings were very early in my career. I was an apprentice and had to send out event invitations (on paper) to car dealers, who would forward them to their customers. I finished the assignment before going on vacation. When I came back, the team told me that I sent the email invitations from the year before. My boss took the blame and sent out the correct versions in a night shift, while I was out. I felt so embarrassed and sorry. Looking back, I never made that mistake again and learned some valuable lessons: 

  1. Watch out for the details. Triple check your messages - especially externally.
  2. Clean up and stay organized. The old invitations should have been in the trash - besides maybe one sample - and not in the shelf for our current materials. The new invitations should have been in that shelf instead of in the mail room.
  3.  A strong leader steps up for his team members and supports if something goes wrong.

entry.title: Introducing Reporting Scope and Data Collection in SAP Sustainability Control Tower
entry.content:
Disclaimer: This blog post reflects the state of the SAP Sustainability Control Tower as of September 1st, 2025.

Why SAP Developed Reporting Scope and Data Collection

SAP introduced the Reporting Scope and Data Collection feature in Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) to address the challenges organizations face when manually collecting sustainability data. Many customers struggled with decentralized, manual processes – often relying on emails and spreadsheets – which made it difficult to ensure data quality, traceability, and compliance with regulatory requirements. The new feature provides an integrated, workflow-based solution that guides users through the process, ensures relevant KPIs are collected, and supports collaboration between central and local teams. 

What Does the Feature Do?

The Reporting Scope and Data Collection feature enables organizations to:

  • Define which sustainability metrics are relevant for reporting.
  • Configure how data should be collected and who is responsible.
  • Guide users through a structured, form-based workflow for data entry, review, and approval.
  • Track and manage data collection runs for different reporting periods.
  • Ensure data is captured, approved, and stored in a traceable manner. 

Step-by-Step Guide: SAP SCT Applications

  1. Manage Reporting Scope
  • Define the scope of sustainability reporting by selecting relevant metrics and organizational boundaries.
  • Set validity dates and add comments for each metric (e.g., materiality, monitoring purposes).
  • Capture the results of double materiality assessments and specify which KPIs require data collection.
  • In this simplified example the organizational boundary is set to Business Region EMEA and the Scope Items are the ESRS items Total energy consumption related to own operations - E1-5 - (37)(AR 35) and Total water consumption - E3-4 - (28a).

  1. Configure Data Collection
  • Assign data processors and approvers for each scoped metric and organizational entity.
  • Choose the data collection method (e.g., workflow-based).
  • Ensure responsibilities are clear for each data point to streamline collaboration

  1. Configure Data Entry
  • Customize the data entry form for each metric, including the data collection cycle (e.g., monthly, quarterly or yearly) and required breakdowns by a master data dimension.
  • Add instructions and enable relevant dimensions to guide processors during data entry

  1. Manage Data Collection Instances
  • Set up data collection runs for specific reporting years and periods.
  • Define start, submission, and approval dates to control the workflow timeline.
  • Generate forms for each reporting period and metric, ensuring timely data collection. 

  1. Manage Data Collection Forms
  • Preview and send out data collection forms to assigned processors.
  • Processors enter data and submit for approval; approvers review, approve, or reject submissions.
  • Approved data is published and stored, with full traceability in SCT. 

 

This new workflow-based approach in SAP SCT streamlines sustainability data collection, improves data quality, and supports compliance with evolving regulatory standards.

Feature status and outlook: Currently, the feature supports quantitative metrics and measures for sustainability reporting. In future iterations, SAP plans to include qualitative metrics and basic custom metrics, as well as additional data entry methods, plausibility checks, multi-step approvals and email notifications based on customer feedback.

For further support, please also visit Data Collection Workflow for Quantitative Metrics | SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: Re: Evaluating SAP’s new MCP servers: UI5, CAP, and Fiori tools in practice

entry.title: Features & functions of app Cash Flow Analyzer (F2332) in S/4HANA Cash and Liquidity Management.
entry.content:
Hello and welcome to the blog post for the app Cash Flow Analyzer (F2332). This blog post is about the app Cash Flow Analyzer (CFA) in S/4HANA Cash Management. My goal here is to provide some insight about this app and explain some features provided by the app. 

Some other blogs posted by me for Cash and Liquidity Management:

1. Flow Builder Plus - benefits, basic details, configurations, etc 

Flow Builder Plus - benefits, basic details, confi... - SAP Community
2. Liquidity Assignment for SO, MM, FI and Treasury in S/4 HANA Cash ManagementLiquidity Assignment for SO, MM, FI and Treasury i... - SAP Community
3. Snapshot, common recommendations, helpful tipsSnapshot - how it works? - SAP Community


Some basic information about the app Cash Flow Analyzer:

  • App Cash Flow Analyzer takes all the data to be displayed from the one exposure table FQM_FLOW. The table FQM_FLOW is updated when
    • For FI and MM, the flow builder report FCLM_FLOW_BUILDER (till S4CORE 105) and report FCLM_FLOW_BUILDER_2 (S4CORE 106 onwards) is processed.
    • For TRM, CML, SD and Payment Request, the report FQM_INITIALIZE is processed.
  • There is no need to execute the flow builder report or report FQM_INITIALIZE manually every day to update the one exposure table. 
  • There are some prerequisites that should be checked if the data is not updated in table FQM_FLOW. See KBA 3595016 - No Flows Generated by FCLM_FLOW_BUILDER_2 in SAP S/4HANA – Troubleshooting Guide, for details.
  • Cash Flow Analyzer app displays the aggregated data and Check Cash Flow Items displays the data at line-item level.
  • To avoid giving same values in the selection filters or selecting the column displays of Cash Flows again and again, variants can be saved in the Cash Flow Analyzer app. The variant can be used to access the saved changes whenever needed.

Why Cash Flow Analyzer?

  • The app Cash Flow Analyzer provides us the comprehensive view of the Cash Position and Liquidity Analysis data.
  • This app gives more flexibility to display the data. You can analyze cash flows for days, weeks, months, or years for all bank accounts and liquidity items. You also have the option to use multiple hierarchies.
  • You have the option to create and save your own variants, layouts, and filters based on your specific needs.
  • See the SAP help guide for more details.

Details about some selection fields:

  1. Display currency and Exchange rate:
    • The app displays amounts in Transaction Currency and Bank Account Currency.
    • Transaction currency amount is taken directly from FQM_FLOW, but not for bank account currency/Display currency, therefore, need to convert transaction currency to bank account currency/display currency.
    • When any currency is selected in the Display Currency, it is mandatory to give the Exchange Rate Type also. The amount is then displayed in the Display currency after converting it using the exchange rate type.
    • The app always uses today’s exchange rate with given Exchange Rate Type in selection to convert the currency.

      Display Currency and Exchange Rate

  2. Scope for FI:
    • This option is available in the newer releases. This field provides the option to select what type of data you want to display in the app.
    • If the Liquidity Analysis option is selected, then all the relevant data having the liquidity analysis (FQM_FLOW-OWNER = GCC) using the chain trace will be displayed. Customers having 'Full Scope' for the Cash and Liquidity Management can view this data.
    • If the Cash Position option is selected, then all the relevant Cash Position (FQM_FLOW-OWNER = POS) data will be displayed. Customers having Basic Scope or Full scope for the Cash and Liquidity Management can view this data.
      Scope for FI and Date indicator

  3. Date Indicator: There are two options available in the field 'Date Indicator', Value date and Posting date. I see lot of confusion about the value date and from where this date is taken. So, see below detail:
    • Value date is same as FQM_FLOW-TRANSACTION_DATE
    • Posting date is same as FQM_FLOW-POSTING_DATE

More information about app:

  1. Overdue column and first date column:
    • In older versions (till S4CORE 107), "Overdue" column will always be enabled. It is not a bug, but this is as per standard design. If users do not like to see the overdue balance taking into account in Cash Flow Analyzer, they can filter by certainty level = ACTUAL. But the column will remain and will be shown at the end.
    • It is not possible to see the amount in Overdue field with Value date less than today.
    • The amount in overdue column is sum of amounts having certainty levels MEMO, FICA, CMIDOC, TRM_O, TRM_D, SI_CIT for date less than entered in Date field.
    • The first data column after the Overdue column will have the sum from overdue column + any forecasted cash flow on that date.
    • Opening balance is zero in overdue column
    • If a user does not want to see the overdue amount in 1st Date field after the Overdue, then see in Delta View.
    • Also see KBA 2547319 - S/4Hana Cash Management: Cash Flow Analyzer or Cash Position details app balance summary.
      Overdue and First date column
  2. Navigation in the app:
    • When you are on application Cash Flow Analyzer Main view, in previous software releases (till S4CORE 1909) you were able to navigate to Check Cash Flow Items app directly. After upgrade, navigation happens from Cash Flow Analyzer to Display Cash Flow items list and from Cash Flow Items you can navigate to Check Cash Flow Items.

  3. Liquidity Item Update: Liquidity Item can be updated/changed manually using the app Check cash Flow Items. You can navigate from the app Cash Flow Analyzer to Check Cash Flow Items to do this.

  4. Hierarchies: There are multiple hierarchy options to display the data. Data can be displayed as per the hierarchy maintained.
    • Bank Account Hierarchy
    • Liquidity item hierarchy
      • When you navigate from the Bank Account Hierarchy to Liquidity item hierarchy, then only those data will be displayed in the Liquidity item hierarchy which also have bank details.
      • Opening/Closing balance cannot be seen directly in the Liquidity Item Hierarchy.
      • Also see KBA 3157646 Cash Flow Analyzer App: Liquidity Item Hierarchy View does not display Opening/Closing Balance.
    • Cash Concentration Simulation

Some common doubts/queries:

  • Why items under Bank Account unassigned?
    • If the field Technical ID (FQM_FLOW-BANK_ACCOUNT_ID) is not updated/have zeros in table FQM_FLOW, then the entries will come as unassigned in app Cash Flow Analyzer.
    • Also see KBA 2461437 - S/4 Hana Cash Management: In Cash Flow Analyzer APP ID F2332 Bank Account: Not Assigned appears / FQM_FLOW-BANK_ACCOUNT_ID not updated.

  • Why some items not in the Liquidity item hierarchy?
    • If no Liquidity Item is assigned in table FQM_FLOW, then it will come as unassigned in app Cash Flow Analyzer. In the Liquidity item hierarchy, it will come under the note #EMPTY.

  • If planning level is not updated for documents in table FQM_FLOW, data will not be displayed in transaction FF7AN/FF7BN. But data will be displayed in the app Cash Flow Analyzer, even when the planning level is not updated in table FQM_FLOW.

  • Some common issues:
    • KBA 3570660 - S/4 Hana Cash Management: Central KBA for Cash Flow Analyzer APP ID F2332 related issues

  • Some of the features/options mentioned here might not be available in all the release. The functions/features will be available based on the system release.

Hope after reading this blog post it will provide some useful insights about the app Cash Flow Analyzer. Feel free to provide your feedback, suggestions, questions in comments below and follow Vibha_Tiwary1 for future posts.

entry.title: Story variable not restricting data by category in SAP Analytics Cloud

I am facing an issue with variables in story in SAP Analytics Cloud. I am also a beginner here. I created a variable in the model (cat_tech) on the Category.ID dimension, with default value = Technology.

In the story, I also selected the variable and even get the input prompt when the story loads. However, even after choosing a value (e.g., Technology or Fitness), the table in my story still shows all categories instead of being restricted to the selected one.

Steps I followed,

  • Created the variable in the model (cat_tech → bound to Category.ID).

  • Set a default value (Technology).

  • In the story, I confirmed the variable prompt appears and I can select a different value.

  • After setting it, the dataset in the story still displays all categories (Technology, Food, Gaming, Travel, Fitness), instead of restricting to the chosen one.

I have attached screenshots. Of course, this is from a dummy dataset. I am also having problem with SAP BW dataset.

❓Am I missing something?

In ModelerIn Story

Thanks a lot for any guidance!

entry.title: Wrong Accounting Period in Depreciation Posting
entry.content:
Hello Everyone

During the depreciation calculation, I mistakenly processed August as period 8, which caused the depreciation for November to be executed.

In the depreciation processing function, if November is executed first, depreciation postings for the four months from August to November will be generated. After that, it is no longer possible to create the depreciation posting for August, since it has already been processed with the November posting.


If I handle this through reversal entries, do I need to register them one by one?
Or, if I just enter one fixed asset and process it, will everything be restored?

Does anyone here meet the same issue? Can you tell me the solution to this problem?

entry.title: Re: Multiple Delta Accrual on the Same Date
entry.content:
For your case, one straight and standard approach is to extend the Contract validity end date to 01.07.2025 or 4/5 days beyond. Run the Delta Accrual for 01.07.2025. Once the missed billing documents are accrued, revert the contract validity back to 30.06.2025 (if needed for audit or compliance).

For any reasons, if the above approach is not feasible, then, consider creating a new condition type for Rent to post the accrual manually. Once this is done, you can create a manual Delta Accrual document and add this custom condition type manually.

On the other hand, if the missed billing documents are significant and you want to populate in the final payout, then, run a Delta Settlement instead of Delta Accrual. Delta Settlement allows you to correct final settlement amounts based on late postings—even after the contract validity ends.

entry.title: Re: DATA Science
entry.content:
Great question 🙌 — SAP has been investing heavily in AI/ML integration, and you actually have multiple options depending on your use case:

  • SAP Business Application Studio (BAS): Works well if you want Jupyter Notebook-style development right inside SAP’s ecosystem. Ideal for quick prototyping in ML/NLP with Python.

  • SAP AI Core + AI Launchpad: This is SAP’s managed platform for training, deploying, and managing ML and Deep Learning models at scale.

  • SAP Data Intelligence: A good choice for orchestrating data pipelines and integrating ML models into enterprise workflows.

  • Data bricks + SAP Integration: Often used when teams want Spark-based ML/Deep Learning with seamless access to SAP data.

If you’re a student or fresher exploring this space, starting with BAS + Jupyter is a smoother entry point before scaling to AI Core/Data Intelligence. To strengthen your skills in parallel, structured learning like an artificial intelligence internship online can give you hands-on projects that complement SAP’s enterprise-level tools.

entry.title: Need latest C_ABAPD_2507 version
entry.content:
I’m happy to share that I’ve successfully passed the SAP Certified Associate – ABAP Development (C_ABAPD_2507) exam! 

For my preparation, I relied on a combination of trusted resources:

  • Official SAP Materials – including SAP Learning Hub and ABAP documentation, which provided a strong foundation in ABAP programming concepts, CDS views, OData, and integration with SAP S/4HANA.

  • ITExamspro – offered well-structured practice questions and mock tests that closely reflected the real exam style, giving me confidence on test day.

  • Community Resources – such as blogs, YouTube tutorials, and SAP Community discussions, which helped me understand practical use cases and real-world coding examples.

My focus areas were ABAP Core Data Services (CDS), ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), OData services, and ABAP on SAP HANA – as these are key topics in the exam.

entry.title: Re: Wrong Accounting Period in Depreciation Posting
entry.content: Incorrect depreciation expenses and accumulated depreciation values for multiple months, making your P&L and Balance Sheet completely inaccurate. Attempting manual journal entries to "fix" it without reversing the original transaction, leading to a tangled web of postings that is impossible to untangle Auditors would immediately flag this as a severe deficiency in financial controls, leading to a qualified audit opinion

entry.title: Re: which products are linked to the SAP RISE license (cl...
entry.content:
Hi Davi,

Sorry it unfortunately requires a bit of a long answer.

The terminology around RISE, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition changed significantly in around May 2025. As of May, RISE is no longer speaking to packages.

What used to be RISE packages with private edition in 2024 would be best matched to SAP Cloud ERP Private packages today, and what used to be GROW packages (GROW Base and GROW Premium) with public edition in 2024 would be best matched to what are called SAP Cloud ERP packages (Finance Base and Finance Premium) today.

If you want to know the contents of the packages with public and private editions at their heart, for a customer subscribing today - this blog gives you all you need:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/unpacking-the-new-sap-business-suite/ba-p/14191891

If you need information on a package a customer may have subscribed to prior to the changes (prior to April 2025 for packages with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and prior to May 2025 for packages with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition) let me know and I can find additional information to share.

entry.title: Re: DRC eDocument Cockpit - Message EDOCUMENT006
entry.content:
Dear Sebastian

Error EDOCUMENT006 means EDOCUMENTHISTORY table is overloaded.

You cannot apply SAP Notes or make direct technical fixes in Public Cloud.

You can reset status using CPI or cancel the original invoice with VF11.

Only SAP Support can clear or extend EDOCUMENTHISTORY in Public Cloud.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Story variable not restricting data by category in SA...
entry.content: This is applicable to Model created variables. BW query variables do filter the stories. https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-analytics-cloud-using-bw-variables-as-story-filter/ba-p/13389772

entry.title: Re: Linking credit memo item mir4 with invoice item mir4...
entry.content: Wondering why you have added 'simple' to your post. On the surface, it seems simple, but linking a credit memo item to a specific invoice item within the same purchase order (PO) in MIR4 can be tricky. Both invoice and credit memo documents are posted against PO items, but they’re treated as separate financial postings. If you want to link a credit memo item to a specific invoice item, then, you can explore "reference document field" during posting. You can enter the invoice number that corresponds to PO item 10, in the 'reference document field'. This will link the credit memo to the original invoice.

entry.title: SAC – How to validate user-typed input in a Dropdown widget (not selected from list)?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Planning mode and I have a Dropdown widget. Normally, users select values from the list, and I can get the key using Dropdown.getSelectedKey(). This Dropdown list's items are added by a fixed array of string on initialization, without default value.

However, I noticed that users can also type a value directly into the dropdown without choosing from the list. In this case:

  • Dropdown.getSelectedKey() returns nothing.

  • I cannot find a way to capture the typed input.

  • I want to check if the typed value exists in the dropdown list.

  • If it’s not valid, I would like to either show a warning message or clear the input.

My questions:

  1. How can I get the user’s typed input value (not just the selected key)?

  2. Is there a best practice in SAC to validate custom input against the dropdown list?

  3. Or if l can disable free text in a Dropdown widget?

Thanks for any help!

Iksuuu

@N1kh1l

entry.title: Mass Changes to Measurement Logs for Registered Products
entry.content:
Hi everyone, 

I would like to know if there is any functionality that allows mass changes for Registered Products. Specifically, I need to add a new measurement Log to existing Registered Products:

Does anyone know if this is possible? Through Data Workbench the Registered Product object doesn't seem to have any related field. 

Thanks a lot in advance!

entry.title: Re: Documents flow from Recruiting to Onboarding 2.0
entry.content:
@visu2015 Nope ,it is not feasible and it is an enhancement request.

Instead background elements need to be directly sync from RCM-EP

Thanks,

Gopi

entry.title: Re: Print 8D Report from Q2 Quality Notification
entry.content:
You can check in SPRO → Quality Management → Quality Notifications → Notification Processing → Tasks → Define Sort Sequences. Here, look for sort sequences relevant to your notification. Each sequence defines how tasks, activities, causes, etc., are grouped and displayed.

Next go to Quality Notifications → Notification Processing → Notification Types → Assign Sort Sequences to Notification Type. Here, ensure, your notification type Q2 is assigned the correct sort sequence.

Finally, go to Quality Notifications → Notification Processing → Codes → Define Codes for Tasks, Causes, Activities. Here, ensure that the codes used in your notification match those expected by the sort sequence.

entry.title: JSON not supported using the Datastore connection WebServiceREST
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts, 


We are using SAP Data Services of version 4.3 SP2. The database is Microsoft SQL Server 2022.
We are trying to read the data using the WebservieREST connection. Using the SAP Article, the web-service endpoint is reachable however the response is received in the form of JSON and not the XML. We contacted the vendor; they said that the API can only return JSON.
Can you please help how to load the data if the response is in the form of JSON?

entry.title: Re: Do we have workflow for the direct supplier invoice a...
entry.content: For Supplier Invoice, yes, it is possible and you can go through this SAP Help Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices but for Customer Invoice, SAP does not support approval workflows for direct customer invoices in Public Cloud to my knowledge.

entry.title: Re: SAC – How to validate user-typed input in a Dropdown...
entry.content:
@iksuuu 

I do not think the user typing is captured. Its just to provide the hints or narrow down the list but does not mean a value is selected. See below.

When I just type value i see all entries matching that pattern but nothing is selected till I select one of the values which are matching. I think you can always check for the length of selected key and if its 0 , put a validation message saying nothing was selected.

Nikhil
